Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Jose Capo, for defendant, Raymond Rivera-Esteves and PTO, Wallace BusteloArraignment & Detention Hearing as to Sotero Gonzalez-Lopez (26) Count 1,4 held on 11/9/2010. Defendant waives the reading of the Indictment and enters a PONG as to all cts. The case is to be referred to Judge Cerezo for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel gives a proffer to the Court and states that defendant has been disabled since 1997, no prior record. Defense counsel requests reconsideration as to bail amt. as deft. and his wife have no money. Counsel for the Government gives a proffer to the Court and and requests that defendant be detain or home incarceration. Arguments by counsel are heard. The Court after hearing arguments of counsel states that it will adopt the pretrial report and bail is set in the amt. of $20,000.00 of which $10,000.00 are cash or secured and the remaining $10,000.00 unsecured. Defendant is to submit and participate in a drug treatment program, impatient or outpatien as deemed advisable by PTO. Electronic Monitoring with curfew from 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM. Defendant is admonished that if he doesn't comply with all of these conditions, the Court will revoke bail. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Mary Jo Smith.)Hearing set for 04:30.Hearing held at 04:49.Hearing ended at 04:58. (mn) (Entered: 11/15/2010)

ORDER denying reconsideration request in 325 Motion for DeNovo Hearing as to William Flores-Lespier (19): Although the fact that there are no videorecordings depicting the defendant handling cocaine himself weakens to some degree the weight of the evidence, it still remains that according to the proffer submitted: (1) defendant leased La Pollada del Topo Bar & Grill as a favor to his brother (1) Jose A. Rodriguez Lespier; (2) La Pollada del Topo Bar & Grill appears in the indictment as an establishment where drugs were distributed and co-conspirators would often gather to plan and discuss their drug trafficking activities; (3) at least one witness will testify that defendant himself handed packages containing purported controlled substances to another individual; and (4) witnesses will testify that packaging and preparation of cocaine at La Pollada del Topo Bar & Grill occurred in defendant's presence. Furthermore, defendant has a prior conviction for violation of Puerto Rico's controlled substances law. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez on 4/5/11. (Lopez, Marcos) (Entered: 04/05/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Jose Capo, for deft., Ignacio Fernandez and PO, Luis Santana. Defendant is present in Court and 1s (U/C).Bail Revocation Hearing as to Carlos R. Rodriguez-Vega held on 5/3/2011. The Court inquires from defense counsel as to the motion filed by PO (docket #370)to which defense counsel informs the Court that they will not contest the issues of this motion and waive the same. The Court after hearing defense counsel and after making inquiries to the deft., finds that the violations indeed occur. Defense counsel is heard as to why bail should not be revoke and a proffer is given to the Court. Counsel for the Government is heard and requests that bail be revoked. The Court after hearing the parties, makes ruling for the record and finds that deft. does not appear to take seriously the orders of the Court, as he was reprimanded on multiple occasions,and therefore, defendant is to be detain pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 03:00.Hearing held at 03:00.Hearing ended at 03:23 Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. (mn) (Entered: 05/03/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Initial Appearance as to Juan M. Lopez-Colon held on 5/24/2012. AUSA Elba Gorbea and defense counsel Frank Inserni were present. As to the Initial Appearance, defendant was interviewed by the Probation Officer and was brought before the Magistrate Judge, was advised of rights and provided with copy of the indictment. Financial Affidavit was issued and approved. CJA counsel Frank Inserni was randomly appointed today to represent defendant. As to Arraignment of Juan M. Lopez-Colon (14) Count 1,4 held on 5/24/2012, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, defense counsel was heard by proffer and requested that defendant remain under the same bond and release conditions imposed in the Middle District of Florida. The Government had no objection to the same. The Court set bond as to Juan M. Lopez- Colon (14) in the amount of $10,000 unsecured. Standard release conditions, continue working and may travel from PR to FL and vice versa for court proceedings are imposed. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 02:07. Hearing ended at 02:15. (br) (Entered: 05/30/2012)
